citation.article-title: Allobacillus halotolerans gen. nov., sp. nov. isolated from shrimp paste
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Allobacillus halotolerans sp. nov.
Allobacillus halotolerans (ha.lo.to′le.rans. Gr. n. hals halos salt; L. part. adj. tolerans tolerating; N.L. part. adj. halotolerans salt-tolerating).
Negative for DNase, lipase (corn oil) and hydrolysis of starch, casein, gelatin and Tweens 20, 40, 60 and 80.
After 48 h of growth on MA agar at 25 °C, cells have a mean size of about 0.6 µm (width) by 2.0–3.0 µm (length) and are motile.
Colonies are round, entire, convex and white-transparent.
Colonies are approximately 0.6–0.8 mm in diameter on MA agar after 48 h of incubation at 37 °C.
Optimal growth occurs at 37 °C, with 6 % NaCl and at pH 7.

In API 20NE tests, negative for nitrate and nitrite reduction, indole production, acid production from glucose, arginine dihydrolase, β-glucosidase, protease, β-galactosidase, urease, and for assimilation of glucose, mannose, N-acetylglucosamine, maltose, malate, arabinose, mannitol, gluconate, caprate, adipate, citrate and phenyl acetate.

In the API ZYM system, positive reactions for alkaline phosphatase, C4 esterase, C8 esterase, trypsin and α-chymotrypsin and negative reactions for lipase (C14), leucine arylamidase, valine arylamidase, cystine arylamidase, acid phosphatase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, α-mannosidase and α-fucosidase.

The following compounds are oxidized in the Biolog GP2 test system: dextrin, Tween 40, Tween 80, mannan, N-acetyl-d-glucosamine, N-acetyl-β-d-mannosamine, d-galacturonic acid, d-fructose, α-d-glucose, maltose, maltotriose, d-mannose, 3-methyl-d-glucose, methyl α-d-glucoside, d-psicose, d-ribose, sucrose, trehalose, turanose, d-xylose, lactose, methyl β-d-glucoside, α-ketoglutaric acid, d-lactic acid methyl ester, pyruvic acid methyl ester, γ-hydroxybutyric acid, α-ketovaleric acid, l-lactic acid, pyruvic acid, l-alanine, d-alanine, l-alanyl glycine, l-serine, 2,3-butanediol, glycerol, adenosine, 2′-deoxy adenosine, thymidine and uridine.
The type strain is sensitive to gentamicin, chloramphenicol, kanamycin, streptomycin, penicillin G, ampicillin, novobiocin, tetracycline and rifampicin but is resistant to nalidixic acid.
The fatty acid constituents are 16 : 0 iso, 15 : 0 anteiso, 14 : 0 iso, 17 : 1 anteiso ω9c, 17 : 0 anteiso, 15 : 0 iso, 16 : 1 ω7c alcohol, 16 : 0, 18 : 0 and 18 : 1 iso H.
Additional phenotypic properties are listed in Table 1.
The type strain, B3AT ( = BCRC 17939T = LMG 24826T), was isolated from shrimp paste.
